revision.text:
{{menutrail|Main menu|Options menu}} [[File:SoundOptions.png|thumb|The sound options menu in [[Chex Quest 3]].]] The '''sound options''' menu gives an interface to consult and modify several sound and music playback settings. Its [[MENUDEF]] name is {{c|SoundOptions}} and it can be summoned with the {{c|{{CCMD|O|menu_sound}}}} console command.
*'''{{LE|Sound volume}}''' (0—1, by 0.05 increments) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_sfxvolume}}}} :Allows to change the volume at which in-game sound effects are played. 0 is mute, 1 is full volume. *'''{{LE|Menu volume}}''' (0—1, by 0.05 increments) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_menuvolume}}}} :Allows to change the volume at which menu-mode sound effects are played. 0 is mute, 1 is full volume. *'''{{LE|Music volume}}''' (0—1, by 0.05 increments) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_musicvolume}}}} :Allows to change the volume at which the music is played. 0 is mute, 1 is full volume. *'''{{LE|MIDI device}}''' :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_mididevice}}}} :ZDoom allows you to choose which [[MIDI device]] to use for [[music format|MUS and MIDI]] playback. In addition to any device provided by the OS, the following choices are available: :*[[TiMidity++]] :*[[OPL synth emulation]] :*[[libADL]] :*[[libOPN]] :*[[GUS]] :*[[FluidSynth]] :After having changed the MIDI device, use the '''Restart sound''' command (see below) for the change to take effect. *'''{{LE|Underwater reverb}}''' (On/Off) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_waterreverb}}}} :ZDoom applies a reverb effect while the player avatar in under water. This can be turned off with this option. *'''{{LE|Randomize pitches}}''' (On/Off) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_pitched}}}} :Enables or disables the sound pitch randomization that Doom used to have until {{dw|Versions_of_Doom_and_Doom_II#v1.4|v1.4}}. *'''{{LE|Sound channels}}''' (8—256, by 8 increments) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|snd_channels}}}} :Selects how many sounds can be played at once. The maximum in [[vanilla Doom]] was 8, but ZDoom allows for a lot more. If the value is too low, audio glitches may happen when several sounds are played simultaneously as the older channels are freed before the sound finished playing.
*'''{{LE|Sound in Background}}''' (On/Off) :{{c|{{CVAR|S|i_soundinbackground}}}} :Controls whether or not to let the sound and music to continue playing in the background if the program's window loses focus.
*'''{{LE|Restart sound}}''' :{{c|{{CCMD|O|snd_reset}}}} :Calls a [[console command]] to reset the sound system. Some options do not take effect immediately when changed and need this to be applied.
*'''{{LE|OpenAL options}}''' :Opens the [[OpenAL options]] menu.
*'''{{LE|Advanced options}}''' :{{c|{{CCMD|O|menu_advsound}}}} :Opens a [[Advanced sound options|submenu]] allowing to fine-tune the sound configuration settings. *'''{{LE|Module replayer options}}''' :{{c|{{CCMD|O|menu_modreplayer}}}} :Opens a [[Module replayer options|submenu]] allowing to configure the [[module replayer]]. [[Category:Menus]]
